learning_outcomes.description: manipulate vectors and matrices, and construct systems of linear equations
use set theory and combinatorics to count possibilities
apply logic to formulate valid arguments, to determine whether mathematical statements are true, and to construct simple proofs
examine the limiting behaviour of functions, and determine their local and global extrema
evaluate limits of sequences and series, and use these to approximate functions
differentiate and integrate functions of one or more variables, and interpret the findings geometrically

assessments.task_description: The assignments require you to solve a set of problems, and to submit your written solutions.
assessments.submission_guidelines: The assignments must be submitted electronically through Blackboard.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
The in-semester exam requires you to solve a set of problems, and to submit your written solutions.

The in-semester exam will cover the first five chapters of the course workbook. This exam is an important opportunity for obtaining feedback on your progress in the course.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

assessments.task_description: The end of semester examination in this course will be held during the end-of-semester examination period. It will be an in-person exam held on campus.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

learning_activities.topic:
Applied class

Problem sheets will be available on Blackboard. Help with the problem sheets is available in the applied class. Solutions will be available on Blackboard to assist with independent study.


Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L04, L05, L06
learning_activities.topic_description: Applied class Problem sheets will be available on Blackboard. Help with the problem sheets is available in the applied class. Solutions will be available on Blackboard to assist with independent study.

learning_activities.topic:
Lecture

We will work through the examples in the course notes during the lectures. You are strongly encouraged to print out the course notes and bring these to class. Completed course notes will be posted on Blackboard after each lecture.


Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L04, L05, L06
